tool.name: SAGA.sim_cellular_automata.1
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayTARGET_TEMPLATE False output_data_GRID $output_data_GRID output_data_TABLE $output_data_TABLE name SAGA.sim_cellular_automata.1 TARGET_DEFINITION $TARGET_DEFINITION TARGET_USER_SIZE $TARGET_USER_SIZE TARGET_USER_XMIN $TARGET_USER_XMIN TARGET_USER_XMAX $TARGET_USER_XMAX TARGET_USER_YMIN $TARGET_USER_YMIN TARGET_USER_YMAX $TARGET_USER_YMAX TARGET_USER_COLS $TARGET_USER_COLS TARGET_USER_ROWS $TARGET_USER_ROWS TARGET_USER_FITS $TARGET_USER_FITS TARGET_TEMPLATE $TARGET_TEMPLATE REFRESH $REFRESH INIT_FISH $INIT_FISH INIT_SHARK $INIT_SHARK FISH_BIRTH $FISH_BIRTH SHARK_BIRTH $SHARK_BIRTH SHARK_STARVE $SHARK_STARVE prefer $prefer response $response outputType_GRID $OutputSection_GRID.outputType_GRID transmissionMode_GRID $OutputSection_GRID.transmissionMode_GRID outputType_TABLE $OutputSection_TABLE.outputType_TABLE transmissionMode_TABLE $OutputSection_TABLE.transmissionMode_TABLE

param.name: TARGET_USER_COLS
param.label: Columns
param.help: Number of cells in East-West direction.

param.name: TARGET_USER_ROWS
param.label: Rows
param.help: Number of cells in North-South direction.

param.name: TARGET_TEMPLATE
param.label: Target System
param.help: use this grid's system for output grids The following data types are allowed in the txt file: png, x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, tiff

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_GRID
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_GRID
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

section.name: OutputSection_TABLE
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_TABLE
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: Wa-Tor - an ecological simulation of predator-prey populations - is based upon A. K. Dewdney's 'Computer Recreations' article in the December 1984 issue of Scientific American.
